content:
Please provide a [Latex] expression to rewrite the following sentence to use a modal auxiliary verb:
The probability of winning the lottery is very low, but I will still buy a ticket.

To rewrite the sentence using a modal auxiliary verb in LaTeX, you can use "might" to express a possibility. Here's how you can structure it:

```latex
The probability of winning the lottery is very low, but I \textit{might} still buy a ticket.
```

This version uses "might" to indicate the possibility or intention of buying a ticket despite the low probability of winning.
